intro: Leandra australis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators.
